str2: This; he, she, it.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To instruct orally, teach, inform. From kata and echos; to sound down into the ears, i.e. to indoctrinate or to apprise of.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A way, road, journey, path. Apparently a primary word; a road; by implication, a progress; figuratively, a mode or means.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (lit: I boil, am boiling), I burn (in spirit), am fervent. A primary verb; to be hot, i.e. be fervid.
Wind, breath, spirit.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To teach, direct, admonish. A prolonged form of a primary verb dao; to teach.
Carefully, exactly, strictly, distinctly. Adverb from the same as akribestatos; exactly.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To know, know of, understand. Apparently a middle voice of ephistemi; to put the mind upon, i.e. Comprehend, or be acquainted with.
Alone, but, only. Neuter of monos as adverb; merely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The rite or ceremony of baptism. From baptizo; baptism.
Of Hebrew origin; Joannes, the name of four Israelites.
